title: No Premier League players want VAR - West Ham's Rice
description: West Ham midfielder Declan Rice says players do not want VAR in the Premier League, after his side were denied an equaliser at Sheffield United.

title: Why Meghan and Harry have Canada in their sights
description: Canadians are excited at the prospect that the royal couple might make Canada their home.

title: Northern England's disused mills 'at risk'
description: A quarter of northern England's 2,000 disused mills are at risk, says Historic England.

title: Mothercare staff: 'We're devastated, it was our family'
description: Hundreds of British shops will shut for the final time this weekend, including the final Mothercare stores.

title: Greaves, 16, beaten in BDO semi-final
description: Teenage debutant Beau Greaves is denied a place in the BDO women's World Darts Championship final by Japan's Mikuru Suzuki in London.

title: Wolf moon: Full moon and lunar eclipse delight skywatchers
description: The first full moon of 2020 coincides with a penumbral lunar eclipse, caused by the Earth's shadow.

title: Russian and US warships almost collide in Arabian Sea
description: The US Navy released footage of a Russian navy ship approaching the USS Farragut in the Arabian Sea.

title: Jurgen Klopp asks journalist to Google Jose Mourinho's playing position
description: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp asks a journalist to find out Jose Mourinho's playing position during the new conference for Sunday's fixture against Tottenham.

title: Samira Ahmed case: What is equal pay?
description: BBC presenter Samira Ahmed won a pay dispute, but what is equal pay?

title: Is this the most elaborate marriage proposal ever?
description: A filmmaker proposed to his girlfriend by recreating the Sleeping Beauty cartoon.

title: Australia fires: Vineyard owner's grief and determination
description: An Australian vineyard's destruction in bushfires led to anger, tears and new "faith in humanity".

title: Veganuary: Do this year's dishes rival the Greggs vegan sausage roll?
description: From pea protein pepperoni to watermelon steak, food outlets are vying to be the new stars of Veganuary.

title: Third raider jailed for £500,000 Gleneagles jewellery robbery
description: Dean Jones was extradited from Brazil to face justice for his part in the £500,000 raid.

title: Iran plane crash: Tehran rebuffs claims it shot down Ukrainian jet
description: Western leaders say evidence is growing that an Iranian missile downed the plane near Tehran.

title: HMP Whitemoor: Prison officer 'stabbed from behind with bladed weapons'
description: The attack on the prison officer and four other staff was "cowardly and vicious", a union says.

title: Boeing 737 Max: Worker said plane 'designed by clowns'
description: The release of a batch of internal messages raises more questions about the safety of Boeing's 737 Max.

title: Gemma Watts: Sex attacks woman posed as teenage boy
description: Gemma Watts convinced victims she was 16-year-old "Jake Waton" and may have assaulted up to 50 girls.

title: Prince Harry and Meghan: Duchess returns to Canada as Queen seeks solution
description: The Queen asks senior staff to find a way forward after Harry and Meghan chose to "step back" from their roles.

title: Stormont: What is it and why did power-sharing collapse in Northern Ireland?
description: The Northern Ireland Assembly could be restored, but what caused power-sharing to collapse in the first place?

title: Stormont talks: 'Deal agreement needed' before assembly recall
description: The Stormont speaker says he must hear "positivity" from political parties, before the assembly can sit.

title: UK police 'discouraged' woman from pursuing Cyprus rape case
description: "Sophie" says she was raped in Ayia Napa and Police Scotland said it would be hard to find the rapist.

title: CES 2020: TV lets you shine a torch into its shadows
description: A special 8K TV at the CES tech show allows scenes to be re-lit as they play.

title: Superdry warns profits could be wiped out as Christmas sales slide
description: The fashion chain's Christmas sales fell sharply amid "unprecedented" discounting by rivals.

title: 'People still want to see the Universe Boss' - Gayle plans to play 'until he is 45'
description: West Indies batsman Chris Gayle says he wants to carry on playing "until he is 45" and is available for the Twenty20 World Cup.

title: Williams and Wozniacki through to Auckland semi-finals
description: Serena Williams reaches the semi-finals of the Auckland Classic with a straight-set victory over Germany's Laura Siegemund.

title: Australia legend Warne's Test cap raises A$1m for bushfire charity appeal
description: Australia legend Shane Warne raises one million Australian dollars (£528,514) for the bushfire appeal after his "baggy green" Test cap is sold at auction.

title: The Papers: Royal 'crisis talks' and jet 'hit by missile'
description: The fallout after the Duke and Duchess of Sussex's announcement dominates Friday's front pages.

title: Quiz of the week: Do you know your Golden Globe winners?
description: Have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: CES 2020: Nreal's mixed reality glasses win over sceptics
description: Start-up's glasses mix together real-world views and computer graphics and should launch soon.

title: Prince Harry and Meghan: Public react to royal 'step back'
description: What members of the public outside Buckingham Palace think of Prince Harry and Meghan stepping back.

title: Prince Harry and Meghan: Who else has taken 'early retirement'?
description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex want to step back as senior royals... but they aren't the first.

title: Like Harry and Meghan I quit my family and I'm happier for it
description: Mufseen Miah, like Harry and Meghan, knows what it's like to walk away from family to be happy.

title: Turks and Caicos corals: Disease threatens barrier reef
description: There is alarm at the speed that stony coral tissue loss disease is killing the Caribbean reef.

title: US killing of Qasem Soleimani is good news for IS jihadists
description: The assassination of the Iranian general has set off a chain of consequences, says Jeremy Bowen.

title: 1917: Faulty lighters and other problems with making one-shot films
description: A long sequence involving Andrew Scott had to be re-filmed because of a dodgy prop.

title: County lines: Call to review 'criminal abuse' of pay-as-you-go phones
description: The government is urged to consider restrictions on pay-as-you-go phones to prevent drug dealers using them.

title: Mystery Chinese virus: How worried should we be?
description: More than 50 people have been infected with a newly discovered virus.

title: 'My ability to see depends on men giving blood'
description: Jo Daniels is urging more men to donate blood, after figures showed a gender imbalance.

title: Why do women pay more for a short haircut?
description: Why do hair salons charge women more for a haircut - and are barbers allowed to turn them away?

title: What went wrong with virtual reality?
description: It was thought VR would be as common as televisions, but despite improvements it is yet to take off.
